question: Joseph Muscat, who recently resigned was the former Prime Minister of which country?
explanation: Malta’s Prime Minister, Joseph Muscat, announced to resign imminently after the political and legal crisis stemming from the murder of journalist Daphne Caruana Galizia engulfed his government. His decision follows the arrest and questioning of one of Muscat’s key allies by police investigating the 2017 murder of the prominent investigative journalist, who had exposed corruption at the highest levels of government and business circles in Malta.
